question:
Consider the following statements about the Unnat Chulah Abhiyan (UCA):
  1. It is an initiative by the Ministry of Rural Development
  2. It aims to provide a clean cooking energy solution to household and community kitchen in rural areas
  3. It is a central sector scheme
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is incorrect.</u> Unnat Chulah Abhiyan (UCA) is an initiative by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) and not by Ministry of Rural Development. <u>Second statement is correct</u>. The programme aims at promotion of improved biomass cookstoves in all the States/UTs for providing clean cooking energy solutions to people. It would also reduce the drudgery of women and children and hazardous emissions to some extent. <u>Third statement is correct</u>. UCA is a central sector scheme. The Target Beneficiaries under the Unnat Chula Abhiyan are individual households in rural, semi-urban areas who still use solid biomass as fuel with traditional chulas for cooking purposes and community kitchens of Mid-Day-Meal Scheme. Only cookstoves approved by MNRE on the basis of BIS standards are being provided to the people.
